item.title: Implementing Amazon SQS with ASP.NET Core 8 API
item.description: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service provided by AWS. It enables the decoupling of microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications by allowing them to communicate asynchronously. This blog post will walk you through the concepts, rationale, and practical implementation of Amazon SQS using ASP.NET Core 8 API. We’ll also discuss the advantages, disadvantages, best practices, and scenarios where SQS is suitable or not. What is Amazon SQS?

item.title: Sending Emails in ASP.NET Core With AWS Simple Email Service (SES)
item.description: Sending emails is a common feature in modern web applications, whether it’s for sending notifications, newsletters, or confirmations. In ASP.NET, integrating email services can be done using various methods. AWS Simple Email Service (SES) is a reliable, scalable, and cost-effective solution for sending emails. In this blog post, we’ll look into how to integrate AWS SES with an ASP.NET Core 8 API using the AWS SDK for .NET. What is AWS Simple Email Service (SES)?
